MajorClaims.MC1: students should always attend class no matter what the outcome of the exam is
MajorClaims.MC2: students can learn more thoroughly as well as showing respect for professors and themselves through attending classes

Claims.C1: in terms of learning, attending class is more effective than simply studying alone to pass the exams
Claims.C3: class attendances are regarded as critical as examination performances
Claims.C4: if students already understand the contents on the class enough to pass the exams or they can study the course on their own

Premises.P1: Classes are designed diligently for the students and professors absolutely bear more knowledge than the students
Premises.P2: Professors not only have the knowledge, but also equip with experiences, knowing how to guide their students toward their academic achievements
Premises.P3: Those who even achieve high scores on exams could fail if they didn't show up in the classes
Premises.P4: Many professors grade their students with class attendances
Premises.P5: Attending class is the most persuasive way for the students to show respect to the professor as well as themselves
Premises.P6: it's students' basic responsibility to attend class
Premises.P7: this is a rather immodest way of thinking
Premises.P8: professors can always give students more than students themselves could because of the experiences and their qualifications as professors
Premises.P9: even if students believe that they are so brilliant to surpass their professors, they can still go to the classes to discuss with professors and classmates
